lines.gurmukhi: jYsy pRwq smY Kgy jwq auif ibrK sY bhuir Awie bYTq ibrK hI mY Awie kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Praat Samai Khagay Jaat Udi Birakh Sai , Bahuri Aai Baitthat Birakh Hee Mai Aai Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as birds flyaway from the tree in the morning and return to the tree in the evening,

lines.gurmukhi: cItI cItw ibl sY inkis Dr gvn kY bhuirE pYsq jYsy ibl hI mY jwie kY
lines.transliteration_english: Cheetee Cheetaa Bil Sai Nikasi Dhar Gavan Kai , Bahuriao Paisat Jaisay Bil Hee Mai Jaai Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as ants and insects come out of their burrows and walk about on the ground and return back to the burrow after their wandering,

lines.gurmukhi: lrkY lirkw rUiT jwq qwq mwq sn BUK lwgY iqAwgY hT AwvY pCuqwie kY
lines.transliteration_english: Larakai Larikaa Rootthi Jaat Taat Maat Sana , Bhookh Laagai Tiaagai Hatth Aavai Pachhoutaai Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a son leaves the house after an argument with his parents, and when experiences hunger gives up his obduracy and returns repentantly,

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy giH iqAwig Bwig jwq audws bws Awsro qkq puin giHsq ko Dwie kY ]548]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Grih Tiaagi Bhaagi Jaat Udaas Baasa , Aasaro Takat Pouni Grihasat Ko Dhaai Kai ?548?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, a man forsakes life of a householder and goes to the jungle for a hermit's life. But unable to achieve spiritual happiness and after wandering here and there returns to his family (One can realise God as a householder by keeping oneself unsulli
